      • emitCandidate

        @Deprecated
public void emitCandidate(java.lang.String id,
                                      java.lang.String targetPhase,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fields,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> metadata)
        Deprecated. replaced by newCandidate(String)
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the resource to fetch when this Candidate is eventually passed to fetch().
        targetPhase - The name of the phase this item is emitted to
        fields - a list of key-value pairs to store information of the candidate. These pairs will be indexed to the content collection.
        metadata - a list of key-value pairs to store more information about the item. These pairs will only be indexed to the job_state collection (crawl-db), not content collection.

      • emitCandidate

        @Deprecated
public void emitCandidate(java.lang.String id,
                                      java.lang.String targetPhase,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fields,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> metadata,
                                      boolean isTransient)
        Deprecated. replaced by newCandidate(String)
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the resource to fetch when this Candidate is eventually passed to fetch().
        targetPhase - The name of the phase this item is emitted to
        fields - A list of key-value pairs to store information of the candidate. These pairs will be indexed to the content collection.
        metadata - A list of key-value pairs to store more information about the item. These pairs will only be indexed to the job_state collection (crawl-db), not content collection.
        isTransient - If true, candidate will removed from CrawlDB when its processing is done.

      • emitCandidate

        @Deprecated
public void emitCandidate(java.lang.String id,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fields,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> metadata)
        Deprecated. replaced by newCandidate(String)
        Emits a Candidate as a child of the current FetchItem.
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the resource to fetch when this Candidate is eventually passed to fetch().
        fields - A list of key-value pairs to store information of the candidate. These pairs will be indexed to the content collection.
        metadata - A list of key-value pairs to store more information about the item. These pairs will only be indexed to the job_state collection (crawl-db), not content collection.

      • emitCandidate

        @Deprecated
public void emitCandidate(java.lang.String id,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fields,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> metadata,
                                      boolean isTransient)
        Deprecated. replaced by newCandidate(String)
        Emits a Candidate as a child of the current FetchItem with the transient flag.
        Parameters:
        id - A String representing the resource to fetch when this Candidate is eventually passed to fetch().
        fields - A list of key-value pairs to store information of the candidate. These pairs will be indexed to the content collection.
        metadata - A list of key-value pairs to store more information about the item. These pairs will only be indexed to the job_state collection (crawl-db), not content collection.
        isTransient - Set to true if this item won't be processed in the next jobs. Set it to false if the next jobs need to process this item again. When true, the item will be removed from the cache when a FetchResult is emitted.

      • newCandidate

        public Candidate.Emitter newCandidate(java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new candidate emitter 
         Example Usage:  fetchContext.newCandidate(id)
                            .withTargetPhase(targetPhase)
                            .withFields(fieldsMap)
                            .withMetadata(metadataMap)
                            .withTransient(true)
                            .emit();
        Parameters:
        id - candidate id
        Returns:
        candidate emitter
